intro: Iozoste sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim iozoste, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments at high altitudes. It features compound leaves with finely divided lobes and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
